00031 class BListException : public std::exception
00032 {
00033   private:  
00034     int m_ErrCode;
00035     std::string m_Description;
00036 
00037   public:
00038     BListException(int ErrCode, const std::string& Description) :
00039     m_ErrCode(ErrCode), m_Description(Description) {};
00040 
00041     virtual int code(void) const { 
00042       return m_ErrCode; 
00043     }
00044 
00045     virtual const char *what(void) const throw() {
00046       return m_Description.c_str();
00047     }
00048 
00049     virtual ~BListException() throw() {
00050     }
00051 
00052     enum BLIST_EXCEPTION {E_NO_MEMORY, E_BAD_INDEX, E_DATA_ERROR};
00053 };

00055 struct BListStats
00056 {
00057 
00058   BListStats() : NodeSize(0), NodeCount(0), ArraySize(0), ItemCount(0)  {};
00059   BListStats(size_t nsize, int ncount, int asize, int count) : 
00060      NodeSize(nsize), NodeCount(ncount), ArraySize(asize), ItemCount(count)  {};
00061 
00062   size_t NodeSize; // Size of a node
00063   int NodeCount;   // Number of nodes in the list
00064   int ArraySize;   // Max number of items in each node
00065   int ItemCount;   // Number of items in the entire list
00066 };  
00067 
00068 template <typename T, int Size = 1>
00069 class BList
00070 {
00071  
00072   public:
00073     struct BNode
00074     {
00075       BNode *next;
00076       BNode *prev;
00077       int count; // number of items currently in the node
00078       T values[Size];
00079       BNode() : next(0), prev(0), count(0) {}
00080     };
00081 
00082     BList();                 // default constructor                        
00083     BList(const BList &rhs); // copy constructor
00084     ~BList() NOEXCEPT(true); // destructor                         
00085 
00086     BList& operator=(const BList &rhs) NOEXCEPT(false);
00087 
00088       // arrays will be unsorted
00089     void push_back(const T& value) NOEXCEPT(false);
00090     void push_front(const T& value) NOEXCEPT(false);
00091 
00092       // arrays will be sorted
00093     void insert(const T& value) NOEXCEPT(false);
00094 
00095     void remove(int index) NOEXCEPT(false);
00096     void remove_by_value(const T& value); 
00097 
00098     int find(const T& value) const;       // returns index, -1 if not found
00099 
00100     T& operator[](int index) NOEXCEPT(false);             // for l-values
00101     const T& operator[](int index) const NOEXCEPT(false); // for r-values
00102 
00103     size_t size(void) const;   // total number of items (not nodes)
00104     void clear(void);          // delete all nodes 
00105 
00106     static size_t nodesize(void); // so the driver knows the size
00107 
00108       // For debugging
00109     const BNode *GetHead() const;
00110     BListStats GetStats() const;
00111 
00112   private:
00113     BNode *head_;           // points to the first node
00114     BNode *tail_;           // points to the last node
00115     BListStats stats;
00116     void pop_front(void);
00117     bool empty(void);
00118     BNode* new_node(const T& value);
00119     void remove_node(BNode* todelete);
00120     bool full(BNode* isfull);
00121     void insert_after(BNode* insertafter, const T& value);
00122     void split_node(BNode* tosplit, const T& value);
00123     void insert_before(BNode* insertbefore, const T& value);
00124     BNode* copy_node(BNode* tocopy);
00125     void insert_into(BNode* insertinto, const T& value);
00126 
00127     // Other private methods you may need
00128     // copy node X
00129     // new node(T,T) X

00132     // empty X
